skill.name: bitbucket-devops
skill.description: Comprehensive Bitbucket pipeline automation using direct Node.js API calls. Monitor pipeline status, analyze failures, download logs, and trigger builds. Use this skill when the user asks to check pipeline status, find failing pipelines, download logs, trigger builds, or debug pipeline failures. No MCP approval prompts required - uses Bash tool with node commands.
skill.summary: Comprehensive Bitbucket pipeline automation using direct Node.js API calls. Monitor pipeline status,...
skill.author: Apra-Labs

security_audit.summary: Legitimate Bitbucket DevOps skill with low risk profile. Makes API calls only to official Bitbucket endpoints. Reads credentials from user-configured files. Creates logs in project-scoped directory. No obfuscation or suspicious behavior detected.

content.value_statement: Debugging pipeline failures takes hours of manual work. This skill transforms Bitbucket DevOps into a rapid REPL loop. Claude monitors pipelines in real-time, analyzes failures instantly, and helps you iterate until builds pass.
actual_capabilities: Monitor pipeline status and find failing builds instantly
Download and analyze logs from failed pipeline steps
Trigger new pipeline runs with custom variables
List, approve, merge, and decline pull requests
Clone repositories and test git authentication
Auto-detect workspace and repository from git config
limitations: Cannot download pipeline artifacts (Bitbucket API limitation)
Requires Node.js v18+ and Git installed
Logs stored in project directory require .gitignore management

use_cases.title: Debug failing pipelines fast
use_cases.description: Find the latest failed build, download logs, and identify root cause in minutes instead of hours.

use_cases.title: Monitor CI/CD status
use_cases.description: Check pipeline status across branches, trigger deployments, and track build progress in real-time.

use_cases.title: Streamline PR workflows
use_cases.description: List pull requests, approve merges, and manage code review workflows directly from Claude.

prompt_templates.title: Check latest pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: What's the latest pipeline status in my Bitbucket repository? Show me the most recent build.

prompt_templates.title: Find failed build
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the latest failed pipeline in my repo. Download the logs and tell me which steps failed.

prompt_templates.title: Trigger deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the deploy pipeline on the main branch with these variables: ENV=staging, VERSION=1.2.3

prompt_templates.title: Analyze patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: List the last 20 pipelines. Identify any patterns in the failures and suggest fixes for recurring issues.

output_examples.input: What's the latest failed pipeline? Download the logs.
output: Analysis: The deployment failed because the database connection string is missing an environment variable. Add DATABASE_URL to your pipeline variables to fix this.

best_practices: Configure credentials.json with your Bitbucket app password before first use
Add .pipeline-logs/ to your project .gitignore to avoid committing debug logs
Use the three-tier approach: helpers first, CLI commands second, direct API as last resort
Start with get-latest-failed to quickly identify the most recent problem
anti_patterns: Do not skip the credential configuration step - the skill will fail without valid credentials
Do not create new JavaScript files for API calls - use the pre-built helpers instead
Do not assume pipeline artifacts can be downloaded via API - use the Bitbucket web UI instead
Do not use the wrong credential field - user_email for API, username for git operations

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code and Claude Codex. It uses the Bash tool for Node.js commands, which is auto-approved.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: Bitbucket Cloud API allows 60 requests per hour per user on the standard tier. The skill caches results to minimize API calls.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my project?
faq.answer: Run install.sh, configure credentials.json with your Bitbucket app password, then restart VSCode. The skill activates when you ask pipeline-related questions.

faq.question: Is my credential data safe?
faq.answer: Credentials are stored in JSON files you create. The skill reads them locally to authenticate with Bitbucket. No data is sent to third parties.

faq.question: Why am I seeing pipeline errors?
faq.answer: Common causes include: wrong workspace or repo name, expired app password, missing permissions, or the pipeline is still running. Check docs/TROUBLESHOOTING.md.

faq.question: How does this differ from bitbucket-mcp?
faq.answer: This skill uses bitbucket-mcp as a library (via git submodule) rather than running an MCP server. This eliminates approval prompts while maintaining full functionality.
